name: Idiopathic Systemic Capillary Leak Syndrome (ISCLS)
chief_complaint: Severe swelling, weakness, and difficulty breathing
treatment: aggressive IV fluid resuscitation with colloids
prognosis: Guarded; recurrent episodes can lead to multi-organ failure and death
description: A rare, life-threatening condition characterized by recurrent episodes of capillary hyperpermeability leading to severe hypovolemia, hemoconcentration, and hypoalbuminemia. Often misdiagnosed as septic shock. The pathophysiology involves endothelial dysfunction and cytokine storm.
